text: I'm Andrew Turner and uh nice to see you
I'm in this lovely place in the central
part of
Copenhagen and I've come up to see um
the go-to conference and this afternoon
I'm going to be speaking about
generative Ai and the future and what's
next for the Enterprise what I'm
covering is a a bit of a history of
what's been going on and obviously in
the last 12 months there's been a frenzy
of activity there been a tidal wave
that's hit the world
um so what we're going to talk about is
some of the kind of there's obviously
been a lot of talk about the
technicalities of generative AI but what
we're going to talk about is the
business impacts and the business use
cases and what you really need to put in
place if you are a business thinking
about embracing generative AI so you
know we're on this kind of what I would
call a hype curve and we're right at the
top of the hype curve so what do you
really need to think about to make sure
that you don't go fall off the curve and
go into the ditch um as you progress now
from today in
2023 uh and really get the power of
generative into your business in a
really truly impactful and valuable way
so I'm going to be sharing some stories
of some of the stuff that we're working
on um uh I work for pracy data we're
based in Sano in San Francisco um and
we've been work working with a number of
government organizations Banks insurance
companies around how they really can
combine data different types of data uh
traditionally people have looked at just
structure data but now obviously with
these what's called large language
models people are looking at how they
can combine uh unstructured data with
semi-structured data with with
structured data to really get the kind
of things like you know customer service
use cases so you know for example you've
got a transaction with a customer and
how does that actually link to maybe a
complaint letter that's been sent into
your call center or you know there been
a call at a call center so how do you
link that kind of conversation with
actually a physical transaction or an
actual transaction in a store for
example or some kind of retail outlet so
connecting those dots is a real big
challenge today and uh obviously what
you need for that is something that
underpins that you need some really
quality high quality data to give you
that real-time Insight so you can
actually operationally uh make an impact
in the business so we're going to talk
about that and um talk about some little
funny anecdotes as well so um we're
going to be doing a bit of a reveal uh
during the presentation uh towards the
end end and also we're going to have a
bit of comedy in this presentation as
well because actually I'm part of a
comedy company called The Comedy crowd
uh we do comedy sketches so I'm in
technology and comedy so obviously
there's not enough uh comedy and
technology sometimes so hopefully join
us and you'll see a bit of a laugh there
as well thank you
